alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 11:55AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Albany and western Laramie Counties through 1245 PM MDT... At 1155 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout over Baldy Peak, or 17 miles north of Laramie, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 40 mph, and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Iron Mountain and Baldy Peak. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley
